title: FREE RUNES, HONOR UPDATE AND POSSIBLE INTRODUCTION OF VOICE CHAT

embed.description: Lead Producer New001 shares details on the future of Runes, the Honor Update, 10 Bans, Voice Chat, and more!

I'd imagine the main reason people want Voice Chat on league is that it's integrated into the game rather than sending everyone in lobby a curse voice or discord link. I really don't see why people think it's a bad idea, I think it will help lower toxicity.
Unless riot can moniter what is said in comms, I see it as a way to be toxic without proof.
You really think Riot won't have some way of monitoring this? Honestly I'm expecting each game to potentially save a file for voice clips of each team.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosThief,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RrNMcT1T,comment-id=00060000000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-30T20:45:19.631+0000)
>
> You really think Riot won't have some way of monitoring this? Honestly I'm expecting each game to potentially save a file for voice clips of each team.

Even if they save a file, I doubt Riot has the time or current resources to go through a 20-45 minute game and sift through it until they find "Dude, You ****** suck!"
People usually aren't as toxic when you have to speak into the mic to call them feeding degenerates.
Why not just mute said people?
You can, but if Riot is trying hard to remove toxic individuals, it would stand to reason that they would need a way to monitor in game comms.

> [{quoted}](name=Sp33d Zer0,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RrNMcT1T,comment-id=0006000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-30T20:23:07.968+0000)

I don't think this will honestly be a huge issue. I'd like to think that punishments for toxicity are given out based off of overwhelming reports of harassment and things like that. If someone ends up getting reported 10-12 times in a day, I think it's fair to say getting reported that often is enough evidence to render a verdict. I honestly think Voice Chat won't be used as much as people seem to think. Look at fairly popular games like COD on Xbox Live or PSN, Usually, you get 1-3 people with mics out of 12 people in the lobby, That's fairly low considering Consoles typically come with a free headset/mic.

> I think it will help lower toxicity.

No.
This all looks fun-tastic, but coming from my COD days, I'm a little nervous about the voice chat (those were dark times).
I believe you will be able to disable it.

How are you going to be able to disable it without completely shooting yourself in the foot? People stop pinging as often when they're use to voice chat (I've seen this with many premades), if you turn off your voice chat you are going to have less information than you have now.
I personally try to type out things and ping even while I'm in voice comm, but I definitely agree that many people don't. Heck, even when I try I ping and type less.

If i have to choose between bad information or no information, why would you ever take bad????

I can play a lot better on my own with no communication than i can with someone screaming "LEARN THE FUCKING GAME NOOB %%% KILL YOURSELF SHIT LORD!" in my ears. I legit never see how people think this is a fuckign argument like??????

I'm a bit confused, Are you saying the argument of cutting off communication from your team because someone is being rude is a stupid argument or are you saying people who want voice communication is a stupid argument?

The argument of cutting off a toxic teammate being bad because "thats less information" is flawed in general. It was the same tired (and wrong) argument about ping spamming. ("oh but then what if they try to ping you oh but muted!" well then they shouldnt have abused their mutes)

there are legit arguments against voice comms, but this one is not one of them. If someone intends to misuse and abuse the voice comms, they will be muted. that's not "making it harder to win from lack of communication" that's me TRYING my best to win and silencing the negative and potentially toxic teammate.

Oh Gotcha, I completely Agree. I attempted to convey this sort of argument in an earlier comment but I think you did a way better job at it. I think one of the only valid concerns I've heard thus far is no way of monitoring voice chats.

Yes, THAT is a legit argument against voice chats. Another one is that voice chats could interfere on lower spec systems and would need a full "opt out" option for the toaster players. It's usually a tech argument or people saying "just use skype/discord/curse/etc. we dont need this"

But yeah i hate when the argument turns into "but you can't mute someone abusing a system of communication cause that will hinder you!" like nah im cutting off the dead weight and then gonna try and drag them with to my victory.
If you can mute chat, you should definitely be able to mute voice chat.
Voice chats on competitive games are a lot worse. So prepare for cancer.

This is possibly the biggest update to league since the facelift for summoner's rift! 

The biggest barrier to new players will be gone. IP will now be focused on the only meaningful content that should matter in this game: champions.

Reforged runes are infallibly a step in the right direction. I cannot wait to see what unfolds.

To those worried about balance concerns, those only need time to iron out. This change is so good in the long run that the short-term woes of preseason non-balance is a small price to pay.

Hope y'all have a nice day!

PLEASE don't get voice chat. League has always been known as one of the most toxic games and is countered most of the time by muting everyone and playing a chill game. If league gets voice chat it will fall under the same problem as other voice chat games but only even more problematic as it would force anyone who doesn't voice chat to  be attacked for not communicating when they simply may not want to voice chat. I've been playing league for many years (season 2) and am dedicating my life to this game but this idea would ruin much of the fun I have with the game. It has even been memed or been made fun of in the past in videos of how toxicity would overflow. Reconsider this idea riot. I feel it would hurt a lot more than help the community.
I'd like the 5 point fucking 5 million IP I've spent on runes and rune pages back.

Ok, new and free runes I'm perfectly fine with, still wondering about rune pages and whether or not we might get refunded for them though. 

Honor system is ok I guess in terms of what you honor players for (I mean I personally liked honoring people for being friendly but this is Ok) and I like that we can earn loot like special skins for the honor system, however I'm not a fan of key fragments being directly moved there as the only way to get them.

The one thing I'm not OK with is voice chat. No. Abso-fucking-lutely no! I know people will argue that voice chat is better communication in game, and I could agree with that, but considering that this is one of the most toxic gaming communities out there with some people raging after they give first blood, or just downright troll and make a match miserable for everyone, I'd rather stick to chat with a Vayne bot blaming me for not ganking rather than go deaf from listening him to him scream at the top of his lungs across my headphones. 

Even if there will be an option to mute him, I still don't think this is a good idea.

Now while i play Shaco, I can finaly tell my retarded teammates when to follow me, how to bait enemy into my boxes, and what to fo in order not to screw up my mind games All while speaking in Joker like voice telling jokes with complex metaphores hidden in them.
